item.title: Blocked drains at crossing, 9th December
item.description:
The drains and gutters are blocked at the junction of lyefield road west and cirencester road causing flooding at the designated crossing points at the pedestrian lights. The water flows down cirencester road and so most likely all the drains are blocked further up too. At least clear the drains and gutters at this busy junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shipton direction sign damaged/missing, 9th December
item.description:
The direction sign for Shipton is has been damaged and is missing at the junction where the Syreford Road meets The A436 Bourton Road. This makes it difficult to find the turn in the dark and is causing vehicles to brake late at the approach to the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken right hand turn lights, 9th December
item.description:
Right hand turn traffic light was wiped out by GT Access Lorry, His load caught light as he was turning this morning, he pulled into Safran after

item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: No connection in path, 9th December
item.description:
Walked down the path here towards the a417 and suddenly the path ends, and re-starts several meters away so I had to turn back and walk along the a417 which was a worry because of the path ending so suddenly and not re-starting. it's very concerning and upsetting. i love walking along the a417 don't get me wrong but it's a but busy at times. nice to see the zoons court roundabout from the path but again can't get to it as the path isn't aligned properly. it's got me quite anxious to be honest
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Bypass, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular flooding of carriageway furing winter, 9th December
item.description:
The road between Staverton bridge and the bend towards the M5 bridge regularly floods with standing water after a rainfall, and at times backflows out of the drain. It restricts the road to one vehicle each way due to the depth of water. This was also an issue last winter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
